Settlement deed for immovable property worth Rs. 3,46,000/-.

On 27th January, 2022
I. Written by: Srikakulam District, Palasa Mandal, Rentikota Post, Rentikota Village, Railway Road,
Door No. 1-40, Kapuram, Saveyam, Son of Dolia Hari, Dolia Niranjana (33) Phone No. 9618846774,
Written by: Srikakulam District, Palasa Mandal, Rentikota Post, Rentikota Village, Railway Road,
Door No. 1 - 40, Kapuram, Saveyam, Son of Dolia Late Balabadra, Dolia, Dolia Hari, (61) Phone No. 9618846774, Written and given settlement document.
You are my little son born in my womb. With the intention of improving your livelihood due to the love I have for you, I want to provide you with some immovable property and I have acquired it as my ancestral property and it is my full right to possess it. As per the 3rd paragraph of this document, I have given you the R.C.C. Daba house worth Rs. 3,46,000/- in words as a reward for my love for you, and I have given it to you free of charge, with all the rights I have in the said property, in the presence of the adults who have signed the undersigned witnesses. From now on, you will continue to exercise the said property as per your will, as per the decision of the Panchayat
D. Hari382

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No 382 of 2022 dated 27/Jan/2022, executed by Dolia Hari in favour of his Second Son Dolia Niranjana, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 405 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 1-40, comprised in survey number 430/1, assessment number 18 situated in Rentikota Village and Panchayat, Palasa Mandal within the District of Srikakulam registered at sub-registrar office Kasibugga(104) is bounded as follows: North by: C.C. Road South by: C.C. Road East by: House of Doliya Damodaram West by: House of Doliya Ganesh
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
